intro: Psorospermum leonense, commonly known as the Leonese psorospermum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are simple and opposite, often with a glossy surface. Psorospermum leonense is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
